qas.question: How can Educational psychology in part be understood?

answers.text: through its relationship with other disciplines

qas.question: How is the method of educational psychology have some relation to medicine and biology?
Where does education psychology draw from?

answers.text: contributes to cognitive science and the learning sciences

qas.question: In universities where are the departments of educational psychology normally held?

plausible_answers.text: through its relationship with other disciplines

qas.question: How does educational psychology go misunderstood?

plausible_answers.text: cognitive science and the learning sciences

qas.question: Where does education psychology not get inspiration from?
where are the departments of educational psychology never held?
What is not an example of a specialty within educational studies?

context: Educational psychology can in part be understood <a0_0><b4_0>through its relationship with other disciplines<b4_0/><a0_0/>. It is informed primarily by psychology, bearing a relationship to that <a1_0>discipline analogous<a1_0/> to the relationship between medicine and biology. Educational psychology in turn informs a wide range of specialties within educational studies, including <b7_0>instructional design<b7_0/>, educational technology, curriculum development, organizational learning, special education and classroom management. Educational psychology both draws from and <a2_0>contributes to <b5_0>cognitive science and the learning sciences<b5_0/><a2_0/>. In universities, departments of educational psychology are usually housed within <a3_0><b6_0>faculties of education<b6_0/><a3_0/>, possibly accounting for the lack of representation of educational psychology content in introductory psychology textbooks (Lucas, Blazek, & Raley, 2006).
